intro: Gonostegia pentandra var. akoensis, commonly known as the Akoensis Gonostegia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Nigeria and Cameroon. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
